text:
Hi, 
I have a client who needs to get . I
just started working with them and they were not aware that they didn't have
support. We want to migrate the servers to 2022, but this will take some time so
for now they need to go the ESU route. 
If they purchase the ESUs now, do they need to buy them again in October 2024 or
February 2025? I'm getting conflicting responses from suppliers. 
Thanks, 
Mark Henry 
--
%2B-hZe%2BFsQPcEWM7W%2BEOvUfQ%40mail.gmail.com

metadata.subject: [patchmanagement] Extended Security Updates for Server 2012R2
metadata.email_text_original:
You don't often get email from mhenry609@gmail.com. Learn why this is important
[https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
Hi, 
I have a client who needs to get Extended Security Updates for Server 2012R2. I
just started working with them and they were not aware that they didn't have
support. We want to migrate the servers to 2022, but this will take some time so
for now they need to go the ESU route. 
If they purchase the ESUs now, do they need to buy them again in October 2024 or
February 2025? I'm getting conflicting responses from suppliers. 
Thanks, 
Mark Henry 
--
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/CAPn4GfR1vXavaU3g-q6nLhBxRo0%2B-hZe%2BFsQPcEWM7W%2BEOvUfQ%40mail.gmail.com
